message.content:
<<<api>>>: List.get
<<<code>>>: 
public void onItemClick(AdapterView<?> a, View view, int position, long id){
    ItemDetail obj_ItemDetail = image_detail.get(position);
    new AlertDialog.Builder(view.getContext())
    .setIcon(obj_ItemDetail.getImageNumber())
    .setTitle(obj_ItemDetail.getName())
    .setMessage(obj_ItemDetail.getItemDescription() + "\nPrice: " + obj_ItemDetail.getPrice())
    .setNegativeButton("Close", null).show();
    Toast.makeText(ListViewImageActivity.this, "Anda Memilih : " + " " + obj_ItemDetail.getName(), Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show();
}
<<<explanation>>>: In the onItemClick method, you can use the get method of the ArrayList class to get the ItemDetail object at the clicked position. Then, you can use the AlertDialog.Builder to create a dialog that displays the name, description, and price of the selected item. The setIcon method sets the icon of the dialog to the image number of the item, the setTitle method sets the title of the dialog to the name of the item, and the setMessage method sets the message of the dialog to the description and price of the item. The setNegativeButton method sets the action of the negative button of the dialog to close the dialog. The show method displays the dialog. The Toast.makeText method displays a short message that indicates the name of the selected item.

Question: How can I calculate the sum of an array in Java?
Please using this api: Arrays.stream.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Arrays.stream
<<<code>>>: int[] array = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
int sum = Arrays.stream(array).sum();
<<<explanation>>>: The sum() method of the IntStream class returns the sum of elements in this stream. This is a special case of a reduction. This is a terminal operation.

   item_detail.setName("Purple");    item_detail.setItemDescription("Cupcake");    item_detail.setPrice("6.000");    item_detail.setImageNumber(3);    result.add(item_detail);    return result;}}this is my code :public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {    super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
